intro: Hedyotis asperuloides f. brandegeeana, commonly known as the Brandegee's dotweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is native to regions of Central and South America. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and compact growth habit.
